Community News

  1. JOB OPENING - Police Officer

    The City of Odessa is accepting applications for a full-time Police Officer. Completed applications should be returned to City Hall with the first review of submissions on April 25, 2019. INFORMATION/APPLICATION

  2. Serve on a City Board or Commission

    The City of Odessa is seeking people who want to get involved in the future of our community. Citizen participation at all levels of the governmental process is valued and encouraged. One way is through service on a volunteer board. Apply today! APPLICATION

  3. JOB OPENING - Public Works Laborer

    The City of Odessa is accepting applications for a full-time Public Works Laborer in the Wastewater Department. Application Information

  4. 2018 Water Quality Report

    Information

  5. New City Ordinance - UTVs, Golf Carts, and ATVs

    The City of Odessa passed a new ordinance on December 10, 2018, in reference to utility vehicles (UTVs), golf carts, and all-terrain vehicles (ATVs) and their use within Odessa city limits. Read on...
View All
/CivicAlerts.aspx

    Board of Aldermen Meeting Regular Session

/Calendar.aspx
  1. Ambulance Department
  2. Police Department
  3. Municipal Court
  4. Parks and Recreation
  5. Chamber of Commerce

Downtown Odessa



  1. Downtown Odessa is a group of volunteers who, with the help of the Missouri Main Street Connection, is working to revitalize Odessa's downtown. Our goal is to join our passion for this community with the experience and resources of the MMSC to make Odessa great. 

    Find Out More

Odessa R-VII Schools



  1. In partnership with parents and communities, the mission of the Odessa R-VII schools is to provide educational opportunities for all students to achieve life-long learning skills through quality academic, vocational, and social experiences in a safe and nurturing environment.

    Find Out More

Start a Business



  1. Do you want to start a business in Odessa? We are here to help! Just click below for more information about licensing, incentives, and informative links. 




    Find Out More

Parks and Recreation



  1. The City of Odessa has many parks, playgrounds, and recreational activities available for residents including the City Reservoir with its 90-acre lake for fishing and boating, as well as Dyer Park with the Aquatic Center, baseball diamonds and basketball courts, and Lake Venita.

    Find Out More
  1. City of Odessa    |    125 S 2nd   |    Odessa, MO 64076   |    Phone: 816-230-5577   |   
  2. Home   |   Contact Us   |   Site Map   |   Copyright Notices   |   Accessibility   |   Government Websites by CivicPlus®

http.title: Warsaw, Missouri City Government!  | Official Website
http.html:
Skip to Main Content

Create an Account - Increase your productivity, customize your experience, and engage in information you care about.   

  • Sign In
  1. Our Community
  2. Government
  3. Parks & Recreation
  4. Online Services
  5. How Do I

  1. Facebook
  2. Twitter
  3. Pinterest
  4. Delicious
  5. Blogger
  6. LinkedIn

  1. Home
  2. My Account
  3. Printer Friendly
  4. Email Page
  5. Contact Us
  6. RSS
  7. Site Map
  8. Translate Page
  9. Notifications
  10. Documents

  1. Early morning catch....hundreds of locations around to seek out and fish!!

  2. Steamboat Landing's Boardwalk... the connecting point for "Riverfront trails" throughout Warsaw. Come & Explore!!

  3. Fall sunset overlooking the Truman Lake Dam....Can you locate this awesome view?

  4. Enjoy bird watching year around. From Red Cardinals to Bald Eagles....birds of all sizes and colors can be seen for all to enjoy.

  5. Downtown Main Street. Enjoy plenty of restaurants, antique shops and local businesses to help you with what ever you're needs are.

  6. Warsaw's Drake Harbor, Osage River & Truman Lake area....look at all that water to have fun on!!

  7. Blue Heron along the river bank at Lay Park boat launch area.

  8. Josh Reno of Parks & Rec. helps with this fishermans catch.

  9. Drake Harbor visitors attending Jubilee Days 2018

  10. Steamboat Landing Boardwalk & walksways around Drake Harbor

  11. Local businesses and shops surround the Court House. Come and explore.

  12. Harry S. Truman Dam. Built from 1964-1979, managed by the U.S. Army Corp of Engineers. The area is approx. 50,000 acres of water ways and 100,000 acres of public & hunting land.

  13. Springfield Fishermen enjoy a good morning catch at West Bledsoe Ferry Park in March.

  14. Dress warm to see early morning wildlife like the Red Tail Fox, walking on the frozen Truman Lake just under the Visitor Center in February.

  15. Enjoy Drake Harbor early a.m. hours for a peaceful experience..

  16. Summertime fun...Bring the boat, kids, dogs and come have FUN!

  17. Stay cool at the Pool. Warsaw Municipal Pool.

  18. Looking out from inside the Visitor Center...Awesome view!! Come check it out!

  19. The Visitor Center. A fun and educational experience for the whole family. Can't leave without visiting the Visitor Center!!

  20. Switchback leads the way to and from Steamboat Landing Boardwalk

  21. Fishing Drake Harbor in the early morning

  22. Fall time at Drake Harbor

  23. The Jail House building built in 1856 was called "Mechanics Bank". Closed during the Civil War it was remodeled into a jail and is still the jail today.

  24. With the growing Bald Eagle population here, you are sure to see these beautiful birds of prey around the Warsaw area. Eagles develop the white head and tail at approx. 5 years of age.

  25. The History of the courthouse started back in 1838. Go back in time and look up the history. Fun and interesting.

  26. The Osage Amphitheater sits on the riverfront at Drake Harbor. This area is host to Jubilee Days and Heritage Days and is available for public rental.

  27. The 1st. Suspension Bridge built in 1895 on the east edge of town. The bridge spans over the Osage River and now is a favorite for hikers and bicyclist.

  28. Harry S. Truman Dam primary mission is flood control, but it also serves as power generation, recreation and wildlife management.

  29. Summer time blooms at Drake Harbor

  30. Built in 1836, the Community Building once had a roller rink and a gun stock mfg. plant. Today City officials & the Chamber of Commerce staff strive to make Warsaw the best place to live and visit.

  31. The Visitor Center high on Kaysigner Bluff. A MUST SEE for all. This center offers a spectacular view & history of Truman Lake, Truman Dam and the Osage River. Totally Awesome!.

  1. Community News
  2. emergency alerts 
  1. Community News

  1. DESPERATELY SEEKING COACHES for Minors Baseball

    The City of Warsaw Parks & Recreation is desperately needing 2 coaches for Minors Baseball, (8-10 yr old). Games starting up soon. Call now!! Read on...

  2. RFQ's-Request for Qualifications for design lighting on Osage Trail

  1. Parks & Rec / Sports

Warsaw Parks & Recreation Link


MINORS BASEBALL DESPERATELY NEEDS 2 COACHES

Minors Baseball (8-10 Yrs old) seeking coaches for the season. Season starts April 29th-June 7 th.

Please call the City Offices at (660) 438-5522 if interested. Season starts next week.
Coaches will be responsible to organize team players, set up practice schedules & notify parent/guardians of practice/game schedules and coach the game of Baseball. If you know minors baseball rules & regulations and would like to coach, call now to help out.
Games will be played starting April 29th- June 7th. Makeup games will be scheduled on any available week day (Mon-Fri).
Hats are provided for Minor and Major Baseball only. Players are responsible for providing baseball pants, appropriate shorts, shoes/cleats & Glove.
Minors BB will have to provide own Cleats, glove, pants. If possible players should provide/use their own helmet.

For more details, please call the City Office at (660) 438-5522.
